item.description:
What makes one photograph more visually interesting than another? How can you make your photographs "look" better?

The design our imagery, how it’s visual components are arranged, can either makes a photo compelling to the viewer or distracting. The impact our photography creates is directly relative to how well we compose and organize the subject elements.

In this workshop we will cover the principles of composition and the creative options that you have when making a photograph. Making images that match the concepts you conceive in your imagination is a challenge. In this class we will review the skills and visual tools you have to conceive and capture an image.

Information covered will include

“RULES” of composition
Dimensionality- using highlights and shadow transitions
Color and tonal effects
Lens selection
Optical effects
Best practices


Executing your own personal vision and gaining control over your results is the goal of every photographer. This class will go over the skills and tools you need to take your photography to the next level.
item.name: UNDERSTANDING PHOTOGRAPHY DESIGN
